title: ELPSA-Based Learning Design for Enhancing Mathematics Engagement

context.prior_knowledge: Basic mathematical concepts and scientific problem-solving abilities
context.additional_context: Activity-centered instructional design to promote mathematical engagement for undergraduate science majors and job seekers, incorporating collaboration and project-based learning using personal devices (BYOD).

learning_goals: Learners can present three or more creative problem-solving strategies for open-ended math problems by applying the ELPSA (Enhanced Learning Process for Structured Analysis) learning design framework.
Learners achieve over 80% participation by utilizing mathematical communication skills (tools, language, behavior) during collaborative processes with peers.
Learners complete at least one mathematical modeling process linked to real-world science problems through project-based assessment.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
